author: Staff Reporter
text:
: While the Delhi government’s decision to scrap management quota has come as a big relief to parents, scrapping of certain “discriminatory” criteria can create confusion for them, during ongoing admission season.

On Wednesday, when the Delhi government scrapped the management quota, they also scrapped 62 admission criteria that according to the government were arbitrary and discriminatory.

The schools have been asked to scrap all such criterion and come up with fair and non-discriminatory criteria for admission.

Once the management quota is scrapped from schools, around 10,000 more seats will open up for general category students.

A total of 20,000 seats will be available to general category after 7,000 of the 27,000 is taken up the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) under the 25 percent reservation quota.

20,000 seats will open up to general category after 7,000 are taken up by EWS quota
title: Big relief to parents
